speaker: TONY
line: Max. Max, you there?

speaker: MAX
line: You're late, kid. You get lost?

speaker: TONY
line: Sorry. Had to wait till my mom took off.

speaker: CHASTITY
line: It's way past his bedtime, Max. He's not cut out for this.

speaker: TONY
line: Cut out for what?

speaker: MAX
line: Oh, there's more here than just trees. Before you can find out what, I got to know that you're not going to tell anyone about this place.

speaker: TONY
line: I won't. I swear.

speaker: MAX
line: It's a vow, Tony. Don't make it if you're going to break it.

speaker: TONY
line: I won't break it, man. Not ever.

speaker: MAX
line: No matter what? Even if someone dies tonight?

speaker: DEPUTY FOSTER
line: Anthony Reed. Got any outstanding warrants, Anthony?

speaker: TONY
line: No, of course not.

speaker: DEPUTY FOSTER
line: Well, I'm going to have to check it out for myself so put your hands on the vehicle.

speaker: TONY
line: Look, I was just taking a walk.

speaker: DEPUTY FOSTER
line: Uh-huh. Right past all those big "no trespassing" signs? Now, you just stand there for a minute.

speaker: TONY
line: Come on, man, I didn't do anything.

speaker: DEPUTY FOSTER
line: I wish I had a nickel for every time I had to drag you kids out of these woods. It would be a lot of nickels. Deputy Foster to Dispatch...

speaker: WOMAN ON RADIO
line: Dispatch to Deputy Foster, can you repeat that request?

speaker: TONY
line: Sir?

speaker: WOMAN ON RADIO
line: Dispatch to Foster. I didn't quite copy your last transmission.

speaker: TONY
line: Officer?

speaker: WOMAN ON RADIO
line: Dispatch to Foster. Do you copy?

speaker: WOMAN ON RADIO
line: Deputy Foster, this is Dispatch. Do you copy? Deputy Foster, sir, what's your 20?

speaker: MULDER
line: Uh. There you are. Heavy traffic?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Slow going. Let's just say I had ample time to read the police report that you faxed me.

speaker: MULDER
line: Thoughtfully provided by the local authorities even though it doesn't begin to tell the whole story.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Sheriff's deputy is slain during a routine patrol. It's a tragic occurrence but I don't see the mystery here, Mulder.

speaker: MULDER
line: Except that the deputy was beaten to death by an invisible assailant.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yes, but that's according to the young man who's accused of his murder.

speaker: MULDER
line: One Tony Reed, and I'm guessing wrongfully accused. He's an "A" student moved here a few months ago from Philadelphia. He's never been in trouble in his life.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, tell me you've got more than SAT scores to show that this Tony Reed didn't commit this crime.

speaker: MULDER
line: Maybe. Take a look at the body.

speaker: MULDER
line: The former Deputy Ronald Foster. As you can see, the report doesn't quite do it justice.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Oh, my God, it looks like he was hit with a sledgehammer.

speaker: MULDER
line: Police flashlight. One blow.

speaker: SCULLY
line: The damage to the maxillofacial bones and the cranium is consistent with a blunt-force trauma, but... I'd say that, uh, Tony eats his Wheaties.

speaker: MULDER
line: Check out the back of his head.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Ugh. His eyeglasses.

speaker: MULDER
line: Penetrated to the back of his skull. Babe Ruth couldn't hit this hard, let alone a high school sophomore.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, maybe if he was under the influence of PCP or some kind of stimulant.

speaker: MULDER
line: No, his tox screen came back negative.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, even so, I mean, stress and fear may have triggered an adrenaline response which is known to enable feats of near-superhuman strength.

speaker: SHERIFF HARDEN
line: Agent Mulder? How long are you planning on being down here?

speaker: MULDER
line: Uh, Sheriff Harden, this is my partner, Agent Scully.

speaker: SHERIFF HARDEN
line: How long you planning on being down here? I'd like Ron left in peace. I don't know what there is to see, anyway. We got the kid who did it.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Sheriff, we don't mean to second-guess you. We're just hoping to be of some assistance.

speaker: SHERIFF HARDEN
line: Well, I don't need it. I got the murder weapon with bloody fingerprints and once the state crime lab matches that up with Tony Reed, it's open and shut.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, uh... we're done here. Right? But, Sheriff Harden, you won't mind if I talk to Tony Reed, do you? I mean, it won't hurt your case and if he did do it, you'll want to know why.

speaker: MULDER
line: What?

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, Tony, this must be your lucky day for visitors. This is Agent Scully with the FBI...

speaker: TONY
line: I'm not talking anymore. Okay?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, that might make things worse and they seem pretty bad already. In your statement you say that Deputy Foster stopped you but you don't say why.

speaker: MULDER
line: Come on, you were cruising, right? I mean, a small town like this you're not exactly living La Vida Loca. I know-- I grew up in Dullsville, too, you know. Nothing to do but drive and park.

speaker: TONY
line: How long ago was that?

speaker: TONY
line: Look. Don't you think I know what you're doing? You're like the tenth cop who's come in here trying to relate to me till I confess.

speaker: SCULLY
line: If you didn't do it, it's all the more reason to clear it up.

speaker: TONY
line: Everything I know is in my statement.

speaker: MULDER
line: Okay, but bear with us 'cause we're old and stupid. How long was it between the time you heard the scream to the time you found Deputy Foster?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Tony, you're not likely to get a fairer hearing than this.

speaker: TONY
line: Maybe ten... 15 seconds.

speaker: MULDER
line: Okay, but you didn't see anyone near the patrol car? You didn't hear anything? And you're still gonna stick with your story that you were the only one there. Is that right?

speaker: TONY
line: I want to go back to my cell.

speaker: SCULLY
line: 16 years old and his life is over unless he starts telling the truth.

speaker: MULDER
line: If you really think he's guilty, Scully, why don't you ask Why didn't he say that, uh, a pickup full of hillbillies drove by and clobbered the Deputy and ran away?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm not saying he's guilty, Mulder. I'm inclined to agree that Tony Reed did not commit murder but I think that he saw the person who did, and he may be covering up for him.

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm not sure there was a person to see. I think there was a force at work here.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What kind of force?

speaker: MULDER
line: I don't know-- some kind of territorial or spiritual entity, maybe. Poltergeists have long been associated with violent acts like this and they tend to manifest around young people. They seem to be drawn to the turmoil of adolescence.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder. Rather than spirits... can we at least start with Tony's friends? Please? Just... for me? I think there's one person in particular I'd like to talk to.

speaker: MR BABBITT
line: Let's wrap it up, people. Two minute warning.

speaker: MR BABBITT
line: There goes half your grade, Max. You missed the midterm.

speaker: MAX
line: Not if I take it right now.

speaker: MR BABBITT
line: In one minute?

speaker: MAX
line: Oh, I've been studying.

speaker: MR BABBITT
line: I don't care who your father is. You fail my test-- it sticks.

speaker: MAX
line: Well, I guess I'd better ace it, then, huh?

speaker: MR BABBITT
line: Take your seat, young man.

speaker: MAX
line: Piece of cake.

speaker: MR BABBITT
line: It is when you mark them at random.

speaker: MAX
line: Go ahead-- check it.

speaker: MAX
line: Maybe I got more going on than people know.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Chastity Raines? I'm Agent Scully. This is Agent Mulder. We're with the FBI.

speaker: CHASTITY
line: Yeah, I remember you.

speaker: MULDER
line: Chastity, what did you and Tony talk about this morning?

speaker: CHASTITY
line: He didn't kill that cop.

speaker: MULDER
line: How can you be so sure?

speaker: CHASTITY
line: Tony just doesn't have it in him.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Do you?

speaker: MULDER
line: Were you there when it happened?

speaker: CHASTITY
line: Look, I got to go.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Do you realize that Tony could go to prison for the rest of his life for this?

speaker: MULDER
line: Chastity, if you know something now is the time to mention it.

speaker: MAX
line: Unless they got a warrant, you don't have to say nothing.

speaker: MULDER
line: Wow, you must be her lawyer.

speaker: MAX
line: Let's go.

speaker: MULDER
line: Gee, butting in to our investigation. I wonder what your father, the sheriff, would think.

speaker: MAX
line: How do you know who my dad is?

speaker: MULDER
line: You got the same last name.

speaker: MAX
line: Oh, you're good. We're done here. Come on, babe. You must have been a Betty, back in the day.

speaker: SCULLY
line: A "Betty"?

speaker: MULDER
line: Back in the day.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Scully. What about the murder weapon?

speaker: SHERIFF HARDEN
line: All I know is, we put the flashlight in here and now it's gone. It's like it just disappeared into thin air.

speaker: SCULLY
line: How many people have access to this room?

speaker: SHERIFF HARDEN
line: Only me and the dozen deputies under my command.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What does the tape show?

speaker: SHERIFF HARDEN
line: That no unauthorized persons came in and no one went anywhere near this locker.

speaker: MULDER
line: Was this here before?

speaker: SHERIFF HARDEN
line: I don't know.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Can we take a look at the surveillance tape?

speaker: SHERIFF HARDEN
line: You can see that the flashlight was properly secured. It's not like we're running some kind of a half-assed operation here.

speaker: SCULLY
line: No one's saying that you are, Sheriff.

speaker: SHERIFF HARDEN
line: Here's when the state police showed up to take it to the crime lab. There's me going to get it. We open up the locker and it's gone. I maybe, uh, didn't give y'all the warmest welcome but if you have any ideas...

speaker: MULDER
line: May I?

speaker: SHERIFF HARDEN
line: I watched it a dozen times.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Could there be a malfunction with the VCR?

speaker: SHERIFF HARDEN
line: I don't see how plus there's no gap in the time code. The murder weapon was the only hard evidence we had. Without it, we got no case. You know what I got to do now? I got to call Ron Foster's widow and tell her that I got to turn his killer loose.

speaker: MULDER
line: Scully, check this out.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What am I supposed to be seeing?

speaker: MULDER
line: Oh, here it comes. Now you see it... and one more frame... now you don't. What do you make of that, Scully? Take another look. Now it's here... Now it's not.

speaker: MRS. REED
line: Are you ready to be straight with me?

speaker: TONY
line: Leave me alone, Mom. Would you just leave me alone? I'm tired.

speaker: MRS. REED
line: This isn't like a bad report card, Anthony. A man is dead.

speaker: TONY
line: I told you, I didn't do it.

speaker: MRS. REED
line: It's just that what you say happened doesn't make sense. There's got to be more to it.

speaker: TONY
line: Well, there isn't. Okay?

speaker: MRS. REED
line: Are those kids involved in this? That boy Max?

speaker: TONY
line: No. Mom, they're the only friends I have here.

speaker: MRS. REED
line: Well, you're done seeing them.

speaker: TONY
line: You don't even know them.

speaker: MRS. REED
line: I do know them-- I was your age once. Tony... we came here to get a fresh start, get away from them bad schools... the wrong crowd. You are doing so well here.

speaker: TONY
line: How would you know? You're never around.

speaker: MRS. REED
line: You think it's my dream to work two jobs? I'm doing it for you, Tony.

speaker: TONY
line: I just want to get some sleep. That's all I want.

speaker: MRS. REED
line: You got a chance at a good life... a real future. We didn't come all this way so you could throw it away.

speaker: MAX
line: Listen to that, man. This car's got guts. Sort of like you that way.

speaker: TONY
line: Who's car is this, Max?

speaker: MAX
line: Chastity told you to shut up, sit tight, and things would be fine. You did that-- it tells me a lot.

speaker: TONY
line: Everything's not fine. We're in a stolen car; a cop is dead.

speaker: MAX
line: Calm down, man. He'd been snooping around. He had to go.

speaker: TONY
line: What do you mean he had to go? What happened out there?

speaker: MAX
line: You got to learn not to ask so many questions.

speaker: TONY
line: Slow the hell down, man. You're freaking me out!

speaker: MAX
line: You ain't seen nothing yet.

speaker: TONY
line: Max, look out!

speaker: MAX
line: I'm going to make you one of us... But I call the shots. Always remember that.

speaker: MULDER
line: Hey, Chuck.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Sorry to make you trek over here for what's probably a glitch.

speaker: MULDER
line: What'd you come up with?

speaker: CHUCK BURKS
line: Nothing but eyestrain at first. Then I ran it through my imaging software. I'm here to tell you, it's not a glitch. It's what the camera saw.

speaker: MULDER
line: Buckle up, Scully. I believe Chuck is about to take us on a ride into the paranormal.

speaker: CHUCK BURKS
line: Well, yes and no. Initially, I was thinking spectral manifestation but, uh, with spirit activity you'd expect to see light streaks, auras, atmospheric disturbances, translucent figures. Whatever this is... it's not a ghost.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Especially since ghosts don't go around leaving synthetic polymers in their wake.

speaker: MULDER
line: That's what the gunk on the floor turned out to be.

speaker: CHUCK BURKS
line: Ah. I dig a mystery with layers.

speaker: MULDER
line: Chuck, I get the feeling you don't know what the hell this is.

speaker: CHUCK BURKS
line: I cross-referenced the shape's silhouette against every organic and inorganic object in the Library of Congress database. The closest match was a Soviet Acula-class submarine.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I think we can rule that out.

speaker: CHUCK BURKS
line: And then there's this weirdness. My enhancement brought up this dark edge... around the anomaly.

speaker: MULDER
line: A shadow.

speaker: CHUCK BURKS
line: It would fit with the lighting in the room. The problem is, it can't be throwing a shadow unless...

speaker: MULDER
line: Unless it's a solid object.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Which is impossible because it only appears for a single frame.

speaker: CHUCK BURKS
line: One-thirtieth of a second. Now, maybe, uh, SCAG can give us a clearer picture.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Scag?

speaker: CHUCK BURKS
line: Spectrographic color attribute generator. I'm, uh, beta-testing it for JPL. It's still in the tweaking phase but the basic idea is I assign known color values onto the black-and-white image. Then SCAG assigns chromatic values throughout the frame in effect, making an educated guess at, uh...what all the colors might be. It still needs fine-tuning.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What?

speaker: MULDER
line: You recognize these colors, Scully?

speaker: CHASTITY
line: Hey, Tony.

speaker: TONY
line: Everyone's looking at me like I'm a criminal.

speaker: CHASTITY
line: I'm not. I heard you took a ride.

speaker: TONY
line: What was that? How did he do it?

speaker: CHASTITY
line: You'll find out.

speaker: TONY
line: Maybe you were right... About me not being cut out for this.

speaker: CHASTITY
line: It's a little late for second thoughts.

speaker: MAX
line: You trying to move in on my girl?

speaker: MAX
line: Saved by the bell.

speaker: MAX
line: Hey... you want to stare at someone, stare at me.

speaker: MR BABBITT
line: Well, class... I've graded your midterms. Save for a few of you, the news is not good. Mr. Pembleton... What happened? Welcome back, Mr. Reed. Expect to make up the test tomorrow. Mr. Harden, you're here on time for a change.

speaker: MAX
line: What's this?

speaker: MR BABBITT
line: Self-explanatory, isn't it?

speaker: MAX
line: I got every answer right.

speaker: MR BABBITT
line: Not because you knew the material.

speaker: MAX
line: Are you saying I cheated? How?

speaker: MR BABBITT
line: I have no idea how, but you did, and I won't tolerate it.

speaker: MR BABBITT
line: Back to business, people. Mr. Geider... Mr. Baker...

speaker: TONY
line: How do I tell Max that I want out?

speaker: CHASTITY
line: I wish I could help you, Tony. I can't even help myself.

speaker: BOY
line: Babbitt!

speaker: GIRL
line: Oh, my God!

speaker: (LATER
line: SCULLY ducks under the police tape holding back numerous curious students and enters the lunch room past a COP.)

speaker: SCULLY
line: Excuse me, please. Thank you.

speaker: COP
line: Just stay back.

speaker: MULDER
line: I'll show you my theory if you show me yours.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Based on the eyewitness accounts of the students I spoke to, at this moment I'd have to say that I don't have one.

speaker: MULDER
line: What about for these globs of goo?

speaker: SCULLY
line: The ones we found in the evidence room?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yep. I'm guessing Max Harden could tell us how they got there.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You think Max did this? Based on what?

speaker: MULDER
line: I spoke to a few students myself. Apparently, Max was angry at Mr. Babbitt because he failed him on his mid-term exam so he had motive.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, he may have had motive but he didn't have opportunity. There was nobody here who saw him even go near the victim.

speaker: MULDER
line: Maybe he didn't need to. I pulled his records. Rising attendance and discipline problems over the last few months, but look at his transcript. As his behavior was getting worse his grades were going through the roof. This kid has changed, Scully.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, Mulder, he's a teenager. Everything about him is changing. His body and his brain chemistry is in a state of unparalleled upheaval, plus there's peer pressure and substance abuse. Any one of these factors could alter his behavior radically.

speaker: MULDER
line: But what if it's given him a kind of psychokinetic or paranormal ability...... that allows him to exert force over a victim without ever laying a finger on him?

speaker: SCULLY
line: That's your theory?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yes, it is. Soon to be proven as soon as I get Max in for questioning.

speaker: DEPUTY
line: Agent, you needed to speak to Sheriff Harden?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah, I want to talk to him about his son.

speaker: DEPUTY
line: Uh, he's with him now. They're taking him to the emergency room. Max just collapsed in the parking lot.

speaker: TONY
line: You hear about Max? You okay? Where are you going?

speaker: CHASTITY
line: Tony, the less you know, the better, all right?

speaker: MAX
line: What? No candy? No flowers?

speaker: SHERIFF HARDEN
line: My deputy told me you were coming and why, so you can just turn right around. Whatever the hell happened at that school, my son didn't do it.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Sheriff, we'd like to ask your son a few questions if that's okay.

speaker: SHERIFF HARDEN
line: The boy's sick. The doctors can't even say what's wrong with him.

speaker: MULDER
line: Max could tell them. You know why you collapsed don't you, Max?

speaker: MAX
line: Yeah, too much teen spirit.

speaker: MULDER
line: You think? Smells like murder to me.

speaker: SHERIFF HARDEN
line: Who do you think you're talking to here?

speaker: MAX
line: Yeah, it's not like you got a damn thing on me.

speaker: MULDER
line: You got a problem with authority figures, don't you, Max?

speaker: MAX
line: If I wasted Babbitt, then how did I do it? Am I like Carrie or something? I used some kind of mental powers?

speaker: MULDER
line: No, something else. You figured out a way to tap into something that gives you superhuman powers. It came in handy with Babbitt and Deputy Foster.

speaker: MAX
line: Man, you're whistling "Dixie."

speaker: SCULLY
line: High temperature and heart rate, low blood sugar, electrolytes show acidosis. All of these symptoms are consistent with extreme exertion and withdrawal.

speaker: SHERIFF HARDEN
line: Withdrawal? From what?

speaker: MULDER
line: The rush. I think whatever it is that gives you the power to rearrange furniture and turn a flashlight into a battering ram also gives you quite a buzz.

speaker: MAX
line: Well, if I can do all that, then what's stopping me from doing it to you?

speaker: MULDER
line: I don't know. Maybe the effect's worn off. Maybe you need another fix.

speaker: MAX
line: Well, as soon as I blow out of here, I'll be sure to get one.

speaker: SCULLY
line: That's not going to happen any time soon. Your condition's getting worse and we're not going to be able to help you unless you can tell us what's going on.

speaker: SHERIFF HARDEN
line: Boy, is any of this true?

speaker: MAX
line: No.

speaker: SHERIFF HARDEN
line: You'd better pray I don't find out it is.

speaker: MULDER
line: Sir... Can we have a word outside?

speaker: SHERIFF HARDEN
line: He's not a bad kid. He just needs discipline.

speaker: MULDER
line: If your son is in trouble I'm sure you'd want to know about it. With that in mind we'd like permission to search your house.

speaker: SHERIFF HARDEN
line: You're not getting it. I'm not ready to jump on a bandwagon and call my boy a murderer.

speaker: SCULLY
line: There's some test results missing from Max's chart. I think we should track them down.

speaker: NURSE
line: Thank you.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Hot off the presses.

speaker: MULDER
line: Anything interesting?

speaker: SCULLY
line: This can't be right.

speaker: MULDER
line: What is it?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Oh, my God.

speaker: MULDER
line: What?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Evidence of cerebral lesions from repeated concussions... arthritis in his spine and major joints. Stress fractures, numerous muscle and... and ligament micro-tears.

speaker: MULDER
line: What would cause this?

speaker: SCULLY
line: In a teenager? I can't even imagine. This is the kind of thing that you'd see in someone who's crashed race cars or played pro football for 15 years. Whatever Max is doing, it's killing him.

speaker: MULDER
line: I think I'm starting to get it.

speaker: NURSE
line: I thought I saw a young lady come in here.

speaker: MAX
line: I wish.

speaker: MULDER
line: Max Harden's personal effects.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yeah.

speaker: MULDER
line: Oh... This is it. Those globs we found? This is where they came from. Speed, Scully. Somehow, Max Harden has found a way to move faster than the eye can see.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder...

speaker: MULDER
line: That would explain how Babbitt was killed. It would also explain how a chair and a table appeared to move on their own with enough force to penetrate a wall. Force equals mass times acceleration, isn't that right?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yes, Mulder, but it's impossible. The human body just isn't designed to move like that.

speaker: MULDER
line: Exactly. That is, that is why his is falling apart.

speaker: NURSE
line: Agents, could you...?

speaker: CHASTITY
line: Max, Max, please, don't do this. You can stop.

speaker: MAX
line: Sure, just like you can.

speaker: CHASTITY
line: I mean, hurting people. Haven't enough people been hurt? This is not why I got you out! Look, let's just leave here, okay? Let's just go away.

speaker: MAX
line: And do what?

speaker: CHASTITY
line: Find a place to get some help.

speaker: MAX
line: Help for what? This is the best thing that's ever happened to me. I can't go back to things standing still... and neither can you.

speaker: CHASTITY
line: Tony, what are you doing here? You went in that cave, didn't you? You shouldn't have done that.

speaker: TONY
line: It was such a rush... Moving fast like that.

speaker: CHASTITY
line: I didn't want this for you. How did you find it?

speaker: TONY
line: I followed you. I was worried about you.

speaker: CHASTITY
line: That's so sweet. I wish things were different than how they are.

speaker: TONY
line: Maybe they can be. With Max in the hospital, we could go to the cops.

speaker: CHASTITY
line: He's out.

speaker: SHERIFF HARDEN
line: Oh, my God.

speaker: SHERIFF HARDEN
line: Hello?

speaker: MAX
line: Boo!

speaker: SHERIFF HARDEN
line: You killed Ron Foster.

speaker: MAX
line: Yeah, I did.

speaker: SHERIFF HARDEN
line: Why?

speaker: MAX
line: I don't know. You want some great reason?

speaker: SHERIFF HARDEN
line: You little son of a bitch!

speaker: SHERIFF HARDEN
line: Ow!

speaker: MAX
line: He thought he was really something-- always liked to push people around. Same as Babbitt. Same as you. I'm not afraid of you anymore.

speaker: TONY
line: I can't let you do this, Max.

speaker: MULDER
line: Yo, Scully... How bad are his injuries?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, it's too soon to tell. He's unconscious and bleeding internally apparently from a blow to the abdomen.

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah. Delivered with this: Max's weapon of choice against cops.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Why would he leave it behind? You think he's doing it to taunt the police?

speaker: MULDER
line: No, I think somebody intervened. I think that's why the Sheriff is still alive and why his gun is missing.

speaker: SCULLY
line: But if he can do what you claimed then... then who could possibly intervene?

speaker: MULDER
line: It's someone who knows exactly how Max does what he does and someone who's finally standing up to him.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Tony. How do we find him?

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, I would guess the source where Max gets his power from.

speaker: SCULLY
line: The woods near where the deputy was killed. You know, Tony never came clean about what he was doing out there.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, maybe that's why the deputy was killed. Maybe he got too close to the truth.

speaker: TONY
line: Chastity, we don't have to be doing this. I told you, I took care of things with Max.

speaker: CHASTITY
line: No, you didn't, and you shouldn't have tried.

speaker: TONY
line: He was gonna kill his father. I had to stop him.

speaker: CHASTITY
line: You stopped him because he let you. He was slowing down. Tony, you've slowed down, too. If we don't get back to the cave before Max does, we're history.

speaker: CHASTITY
line: Hurry!

speaker: TONY
line: I'll catch up.

speaker: TONY
line: Chastity?

speaker: TONY
line: Are you okay?

speaker: MAX
line: You're late, kid.

speaker: TONY
line: What did you do to her?

speaker: MAX
line: Well, she took a swing at me. You believe that? You got it all turned around.

speaker: MAX
line: Come on, man. Who do you think you're dealing with?

speaker: MAX
line: All I ever wanted was for you to be my friend, Tony. You stuck a knife in my back. Now I'm going to mess you up.

speaker: CHASTITY
line: I'm sorry, Tony. I can't go back.

speaker: TONY
line: Chastity?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Did the USGS show up?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah. 18 geologists and three semis full of gear. They covered every inch of that cave.

speaker: SCULLY
line: And what did they come up with?

speaker: MULDER
line: Nothing. Well, bat guano and above-normal magnetic field readings but nothing that would cause a physiological effect.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What'd you expect them to find, Mulder?

speaker: MULDER
line: I don't know. A vortex, like the one in Oregon. Gravitational aberrations, unique chemical compositions, uh, relics that would indicate that the cave was a sacred site... something, anything. I don't know.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, you and I were both in there and nothing happened to us. We're still slowpoking around.

speaker: MULDER
line: What if we're too old? Well, you said that teenagers differ from adults chemically and physiologically. What if whatever is in that cave affects only them?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, that's doubtful. But no more so than any other theory. I mean, it's worth checking out.

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah? Well, we can't. As of an hour ago, they pumped concrete into the cave. Sealed it for precautionary reasons. We'll never know. How's he doing?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Bruises and muscle strains, mostly. He'll recover... go back to being a normal kid.
